Title: UK closes exploration license round with priority blocks potentially producing in 18 months
Description: The UK’s North Sea Transition Authority (NSTA) closed its latest round of exploration licenses for offshore gas blocks, among which four priority areas with known reserves could start producing in 18 months. This could limit the UK’s reliance on LNG.
Author: DE

Title: Wheatstone and Darwin LNG cargoes add to spot supply availability
Description: Santos’ 3.7 mtpa Darwin and Chevron’s 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone  LNG projects in Australia each have one spot cargo to offer through tenders this week, increasing spot supply availability for February and March. Both tenders close on Jan. 19.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks up to six LNG cargoes for February-April import slots
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender seeking up to six cargoes for delivery between February and April to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Shell’s Prelude FLNG facility resumes LNG cargo loadings after fire-led shutdown in December
Description: Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia is scheduled to resume loadings today, following an unplanned shutdown last month due to a fire.
Author: CK
